queries: [WEB] adaptive mesh refinement cosmology software github

tools.name: 21CMMC
tools.one_line_profile: MCMC sampler for constraining 21cmFAST parameters
tools.detailed_description: A Monte Carlo Markov Chain (MCMC) analysis tool designed to constrain astrophysical parameters using the 21cmFAST semi-numerical simulation code. It enables parameter estimation for the Epoch of Reionization (EoR) and Cosmic Dawn.

tools.name: 21cmEMU
tools.one_line_profile: Emulator for 21cmFAST summary statistics
tools.detailed_description: A neural network-based emulator that predicts the summary statistics (such as power spectra) of the 21cm signal generated by 21cmFAST, enabling rapid parameter space exploration and inference.

tools.name: 21cmFAST
tools.one_line_profile: Semi-numerical simulation code for the cosmological 21cm signal
tools.detailed_description: A powerful semi-numerical code for simulating the cosmological 21cm signal from the Epoch of Reionization and Cosmic Dawn. It generates 3D ionization, density, and temperature fields efficiently.

tools.name: Nyx
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive mesh N-body hydro cosmological simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A massively parallel cosmological simulation code built on the AMReX framework. It solves equations for compressible hydrodynamics and N-body dark matter particles on an adaptive grid to study the Lyman-alpha forest and large scale structure.

tools.name: GW_turbulence
tools.one_line_profile: Gravitational wave generation from MHD turbulence simulations
tools.detailed_description: A tool to post-process numerical simulations of Magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) turbulence (specifically from the Pencil Code) to calculate and analyze the resulting stochastic gravitational wave background.

tools.name: ecosmog-cvg
tools.one_line_profile: N-body code for Cubic Vector Galileon gravity
tools.detailed_description: A modified version of the RAMSES/ECOSMOG N-body code designed to simulate cosmological structure formation under Cubic Vector Galileon modified gravity theories.

tools.name: JULIA
tools.one_line_profile: Post-processing tools for Enzo cosmological data
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Julia programs for analyzing and post-processing grid-based cosmological simulation data, specifically tailored for the Enzo code outputs.

tools.name: MG-PICOLA
tools.one_line_profile: COLA-based cosmological simulation code for Modified Gravity
tools.detailed_description: An extension of the L-PICOLA code that implements the COLA (COmoving Lagrangian Acceleration) method for fast cosmological structure formation simulations in theories with scale-dependent growth (Modified Gravity) and massive neutrinos.

tools.name: AthenaK
tools.one_line_profile: Performance-portable astrophysical AMR-MHD code
tools.detailed_description: A performance-portable rewrite of the Athena++ astrophysical magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code using Kokkos. It supports adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) and runs efficiently on CPUs and GPUs for astrophysical fluid dynamics simulations.

tools.name: 21cmvFAST
tools.one_line_profile: Modified version of 21cmFAST for simulating cosmic dawn with dark matter-baryon relative velocities
tools.detailed_description: A modified version of the semi-numerical cosmological simulation code 21cmFAST. It incorporates the effects of dark matter-baryon relative velocities on the 21-cm signal during the cosmic dawn and epoch of reionization.

tools.name: Zeus21
tools.one_line_profile: Fast semi-analytical code for simulating the cosmic dawn 21-cm signal
tools.detailed_description: Zeus21 (Zero-point Energy Universe Solver 21) is a Python-based tool for simulating the 21-cm signal from the cosmic dawn and epoch of reionization. It is designed to be fast and efficient, enabling rapid exploration of parameter space for cosmological inference.

tools.name: MP-Gadget
tools.one_line_profile: Massively-parallel cosmological N-body and hydrodynamics simulation code
tools.detailed_description: MP-Gadget is a massively parallel version of the Gadget cosmological N-body and hydrodynamics simulation code. It is designed to run on large supercomputers and simulate the formation of structure in the universe, including dark matter and baryonic physics.

tools.name: Mera.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia toolkit for analyzing astrophysical simulation data (RAMSES)
tools.detailed_description: Mera.jl is a package for analyzing and visualizing data from astrophysical simulations, specifically tailored for the RAMSES code. It provides high-level functions for reading, processing, and plotting AMR grid data.

tools.name: Nyxus
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable image feature extraction library for bioimaging
tools.detailed_description: Nyxus is a high-performance, scalable library for calculating features from intensity-label image data. It is primarily used in bioimage analysis (microscopy) to extract shape, intensity, and texture features from cells and tissues.

tools.name: Athena++
tools.one_line_profile: Radiation GRMHD code and adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) framework
tools.detailed_description: Athena++ is a complete re-write of the Athena astrophysical magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code in C++. It is a grid-based code for astrophysical gas dynamics, supporting special and general relativistic MHD, radiation transport, and adaptive mesh refinement (AMR).

tools.name: SWIFT
tools.one_line_profile: Modern particle-based hydrodynamics and gravity code for astrophysics
tools.detailed_description: SWIFT is a hydrodynamics and gravity code for astrophysics and cosmology. It uses a task-based parallelism approach to perform SPH (Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics) and N-body simulations efficiently on modern supercomputing architectures.

tools.name: Shamrock
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-GPU hydrodynamics framework for astrophysics supporting SPH and AMR
tools.detailed_description: The Shamrock Framework is an open-source, multi-GPU hydrodynamics code designed for astrophysical simulations. It supports Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) and Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR), scaling from local machines to exascale supercomputers.

tools.name: Py-SPHViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for rendering cosmological simulations using SPH scheme
tools.detailed_description: Py-SPHViewer is a Python framework designed for rendering and visualizing cosmological simulations that use the Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) scheme. It allows for high-quality visualization of particle data.

tools.name: ARTIS
tools.one_line_profile: 3D non-LTE Monte Carlo radiative transfer code for supernovae/kilonovae
tools.detailed_description: ARTIS is a 3D non-LTE Monte Carlo radiative transfer code specifically designed for simulating the spectral synthesis and light curves of supernovae and kilonovae events.

tools.name: 21cmfish
tools.one_line_profile: Fisher matrix analysis tool for 21cmFAST simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to perform Fisher matrix analyses specifically for 21cmFAST, aiding in parameter estimation and forecasting for 21cm cosmology.

tools.name: Cholla
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-based hydrodynamics code for astrophysical simulations
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-based hydrodynamics code (Computational Hydrodynamics On ParaLLel Architectures) designed for astrophysical simulations, leveraging native CUDA implementation for high performance.

tools.name: 21cmVAE
tools.one_line_profile: Emulator for the 21-cm global signal using Variational Autoencoders
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning based emulator using Variational Autoencoders (VAE) to accurately predict the 21-cm global signal for cosmic dawn and reionization studies.

tools.name: BEoRN
tools.one_line_profile: Simulator for 21-cm signal from cosmic dawn and reionization
tools.detailed_description: A code to generate 3D maps of the 21-cm signal from the cosmic dawn and the epoch of reionization, modeling the relevant astrophysical processes.

tools.name: Cosmograph
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological General Relativity and Hydrodynamics simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A simulation code for Cosmological General Relativity and Hydrodynamics, capable of handling perfect fluid and particle dynamics in a cosmological context.

tools.name: Gotham Web Tools
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for analysis of hydrodynamic simulations and galaxy surveys
tools.detailed_description: A modular Python toolkit for analyzing hydrodynamic simulations and spectroscopic galaxy surveys, focusing on cosmic web characterization and statistical data analysis.

tools.name: cwitools
tools.one_line_profile: Data reduction and analysis tools for Cosmic Web Imager
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for reducing and analyzing data from the Cosmic Web Imager (CWI) and Palomar Cosmic Web Imager (PCWI) instruments.

tools.name: ArepoVTK
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization toolkit for AREPO simulations
tools.detailed_description: A ray-tracing Voronoi tessellation volume renderer specifically designed for visualizing simulation data from the AREPO moving-mesh code.

tools.name: AREPO
tools.one_line_profile: Moving-mesh code for cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: The public version of the AREPO code, a moving-mesh hydrodynamics simulation code widely used for large-scale structure and galaxy formation simulations.

tools.name: Enzo
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive mesh-refinement simulation code for astrophysics
tools.detailed_description: An adaptive mesh-refinement (AMR) simulation code designed for rich multi-physics astrophysical simulations, including hydrodynamics, MHD, and radiation transport.

tools.name: Enzo-E
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale-ready version of the Enzo simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A re-implementation of the Enzo simulation code built on Charm++ to support exascale computing capabilities for astrophysical simulations.

tools.name: Rabacus
tools.one_line_profile: Analytic radiative transfer calculations for cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing analytic radiative transfer calculations in simple geometries relevant to cosmology and astrophysics, including tools for power spectrum and mass function calculations.

tools.name: C2-Ray3Dm1D_Helium
tools.one_line_profile: Radiative transfer code with Helium support
tools.detailed_description: A version of the C2-Ray radiative transfer and photo-ionization code that includes Helium physics, combining 1D and 3D approaches for reionization simulations.

tools.name: Ginnungagap
tools.one_line_profile: Initial conditions generator for cosmological N-body and hydrodynamic simulations
tools.detailed_description: Ginnungagap is a code for generating initial conditions for cosmological simulations. It creates particle distributions and grid fields based on cosmological parameters, serving as input for N-body/hydro codes like Gadget.

tools.name: 21cmFirstCLASS
tools.one_line_profile: Extension of 21cmFAST interfacing with CLASS for consistent initial conditions
tools.detailed_description: 21cmFirstCLASS is an extension of the 21cmFAST code that interfaces with the Boltzmann solver CLASS. It generates initial conditions at recombination that are consistent with the input cosmological model, improving the accuracy of reionization simulations.

tools.name: librosa
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for audio and music signal analysis
tools.detailed_description: Librosa is a python package for music and audio analysis. It provides the building blocks necessary to create music information retrieval systems, including feature extraction, decomposition, and spectral analysis.

tools.name: ATHENA
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced Techniques for High dimensional parameter spaces to Enhance Numerical Analysis
tools.detailed_description: ATHENA is a Python package for reduction of high dimensional parameter spaces in the context of numerical analysis. It implements active subspaces and other dimension reduction techniques to facilitate simulation-based engineering and science.

tools.name: RAMSES
tools.one_line_profile: Grid-based hydrodynamical code for astrophysical systems
tools.detailed_description: RAMSES is an open source code to model astrophysical systems, featuring self-gravitating, magnetised, compressible, radiative fluid flows. It uses Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) technique.

tools.name: ARES
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerated Reionization Era Simulations code
tools.detailed_description: ARES (Accelerated Reionization Era Simulations) is a code designed to model the properties of the first stars and galaxies and their impact on the intergalactic medium (IGM) during the Cosmic Dawn and Epoch of Reionization.

tools.name: HYREC-2
tools.one_line_profile: Code for calculating cosmological recombination history
tools.detailed_description: A code to compute the recombination history of the universe, solving for the ionization history of hydrogen and helium. It is an updated version of the HYREC code, essential for CMB anisotropy calculations.

tools.name: Nyx
tools.one_line_profile: High fidelity astrodynamics toolkit library
tools.detailed_description: A fast, reliable, and validated astrodynamics toolkit for orbit propagation, mission analysis, and space navigation. It supports high-fidelity force models and is available in Rust and Python.

tools.name: Osyris
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization and data analysis utility for RAMSES astrophysical data
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python library for reading, manipulating, and visualizing data from the RAMSES astrophysical simulation code. It provides high-level plotting functions for mesh and particle data.

tools.name: AthenaPK
tools.one_line_profile: Performance portable MHD code based on Athena++ and Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A performance-portable version of the Athena++ astrophysical magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code, built on the Parthenon framework and Kokkos to run efficiently on various hardware architectures (CPUs/GPUs).

tools.name: Pencil Code
tools.one_line_profile: High-order finite-difference code for compressible MHD
tools.detailed_description: A high-order finite-difference code for solving compressible hydrodynamic flows with magnetic fields and particles. It is widely used in astrophysics for studying turbulence, dynamos, and planet formation.

tools.name: GIZMO
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-physics massively-parallel simulation code for astrophysics
tools.detailed_description: A flexible, multi-method magneto-hydrodynamics and gravity code. It supports various fluid solvers (Meshless Finite Mass/Volume, SPH) and is used for simulating galaxy formation, star formation, and cosmology.

tools.name: ramsesGPU
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-optimized version of the RAMSES MHD code
tools.detailed_description: A version of the RAMSES astrophysics MHD simulation code optimized for large clusters of GPUs, enabling high-performance cosmological and astrophysical simulations.

tools.name: cora
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation code for 21cm Intensity Mapping skies
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for simulating skies for 21cm Intensity Mapping experiments, including models for galactic and extragalactic foregrounds and instrumental effects.

tools.name: driftscan
tools.one_line_profile: Data analysis tools for transit radio interferometers
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for the analysis of data from transit radio interferometers, specifically tailored for 21cm cosmology experiments. It includes routines for calibration and map making.

tools.name: ramses-package
tools.one_line_profile: R Package for Antimicrobial Stewardship & Surveillance
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed for data-driven antimicrobial stewardship and surveillance in hospitals. It facilitates the analysis of patient and microbiology data to track resistance patterns.

tools.name: RAMSES
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive Mesh Refinement code for astrophysical simulations
tools.detailed_description: The official repository for RAMSES, a grid-based hydrodynamics code with Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR). It is used to simulate the evolution of the universe, galaxy formation, and star formation.

tools.name: clustep
tools.one_line_profile: Initial condition generator for galaxy cluster halo simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that generates initial conditions for galaxy cluster halo simulations, producing outputs compatible with GADGET2 and RAMSES formats. It facilitates the setup of cosmological N-body/hydrodynamical simulations.

tools.name: galstep
tools.one_line_profile: Initial condition generator for spiral galaxy simulations
tools.detailed_description: A tool for generating initial conditions for spiral galaxy simulations, supporting output formats for GADGET2, RAMSES, and HDF5. It is used to initialize isolated galaxy models for astrophysical dynamics studies.

tools.name: RAMSES-yOMP
tools.one_line_profile: Performance-optimized version of the RAMSES astrophysical simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A modified version of the RAMSES code (Teyssier 2002) for astrophysical fluid dynamics, featuring performance optimizations (likely OpenMP related). RAMSES is a grid-based hydrodynamics solver with Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR).

tools.name: rur
tools.one_line_profile: Ramses Universal Reader for simulation data analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to read and analyze output data from RAMSES simulations. It provides interfaces to load grid-based fields and particle data for post-processing and visualization.

tools.name: paicos
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis package for Arepo cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: An object-oriented Python package specifically designed for the analysis of cosmological simulations performed with the Arepo code (a moving-mesh hydrodynamics solver). It assists in processing snapshot data and extracting physical properties.

tools.name: arepy
tools.one_line_profile: Python module for Arepo simulation output analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for reading and analyzing output files and snapshots from Arepo, a moving-mesh code used for astrophysical and cosmological simulations.

tools.name: DM21cm
tools.one_line_profile: Modeling inhomogeneous energy injection in 21cm cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for modeling the effects of inhomogeneous energy injection (e.g., from Dark Matter annihilation or decay) on the 21cm cosmological signal. It is used for theoretical predictions and constraints in cosmology.
